parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the background event to cancel.

name: snap_clearState
description: `snap_clearState` clears the state of the Snap.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the extension is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the extension is locked or unlocked.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the WebSocket connection to close.

parameters.name: ui
parameters.description: The components to display in the interface.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_createInterface` method, which is the id of the created interface.

parameters.type: { content: JSXElement } | { id: string } | { type: "alert"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "alert"; id: string } | { type: "confirmation"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "confirmation"; id: string } | { type: "prompt"; content: JSXElement; placeholder?: string | null } | { type: "prompt"; id: string; placeholder?: string | null }

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the trace.
Defaults to 'default' if not provided.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the trace.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Override the end time of the trace.

result.type: { id: string; scheduledAt: string; snapId: SnapId; date: string; request: { method: string; jsonrpc?: "2.0" | null; id?: number | string | null; params?: Json[] | Record<string, Json> | null } }[]
result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_getBackgroundEvents` method.

It consists of an array background events (if any) for a snap.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.

result.name: depth
result.description: The 0-indexed path depth of this node.

result.name: masterFingerprint
result.description:
The fingerprint of the master node, i.e., the node at depth 0. May be
undefined if this node was created from an extended key.

result.name: parentFingerprint
result.description: The fingerprint of the parent key, or 0 if this is a master node.

result.name: index
result.description: The index of the node, or 0 if this is a master node.

result.name: network
result.description:
The network for the node. This is only used for extended keys, and defaults
to `mainnet`.

result.name: privateKey
result.description: The (optional) private key of this node.

result.name: publicKey
result.description: The public key of this node.

result.name: chainCode
result.description: The chain code of this node.

result.name: curve
result.description: The name of the curve used by the node.

parameters.name: compressed
parameters.description: Whether to return the compressed public key. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_getBip32PublicKey` method.

It is the public key in hexadecimal format, in either compressed or
uncompressed format, depending on the `compressed` parameter.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.

result.name: depth
result.description:
The 0-indexed BIP-44 path depth of this node.

A BIP-44 path is of the form:

`m / 44' / coin_type' / account' / change / address_index`

With the following depths:

`0 / 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5`

result.name: masterFingerprint
result.description:
The fingerprint of the master node, i.e., the node at depth 0. May be
undefined if this node was created from an extended key.

result.name: parentFingerprint
result.description: The fingerprint of the parent key, or 0 if this is a master node.

result.name: index
result.description: The index of the node, or 0 if this is a master node.

result.name: network
result.description:
The network for the node. This is only used for extended keys, and defaults
to `mainnet`.

result.name: privateKey
result.description:
The hexadecimal string representation of the private key for this node.
May be `undefined` if the node is a public node.

result.name: publicKey
result.description: The hexadecimal string representation of the public key for this node.

result.name: chainCode
result.description: The hexadecimal string representation of the chain code for this node.

name: snap_getClientStatus
description: `snap_getClientStatus` returns useful information about the client running the snap.

result.name: clientVersion
result.description: The semantic version of the client that the Snap is running in.

result.name: platformVersion
result.description: The Snaps Platform version that the client is running.

result.name: locked
result.description: A boolean flag that indicates whether the client is locked or not.

result.name: active
result.description: A boolean flag that indicates whether the client is active or not.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol.

result.type: { currency: string; conversionRate: number; conversionDate: number; usdConversionRate?: number | null } | null
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getCurrencyRate` method, which is the {@link CurrencyRate} object.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
The version of the entropy to retrieve. This is used for backwards
compatibility. As of now, only version 1 is supported.

parameters.name: salt
parameters.description: The optional salt to use when deriving the entropy.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getEntropy` method.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file to retrieve.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The encoding to use when retrieving the file.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getFile` method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interface id.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getInterfaceContext` method, which is the context for a given interface.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interface id.

result.type: Record<string, { addresses: `${string}:${string}:${string}`[]; accountId: string } | { name: string; size: number; contentType: string; contents: string } | { symbol: string; name: string; asset: `${string}:${string}/${string}:${string}` } | boolean | Record<string, { addresses: `${string}:${string}:${string}`[]; accountId: string } | { name: string; size: number; contentType: string; contents: string } | { symbol: string; name: string; asset: `${string}:${string}/${string}:${string}` } | boolean | string | null> | string | null>
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getInterfaceState` method, which is the state of the interface.

The result returned by the `snap_getLocale` method.

It is the locale of the user's MetaMask extension.

result.name: locale
result.description: The user's selected locale.

result.name: currency
result.description: The user's selected currency.

result.name: hideBalances
result.description: Whether the user has chosen to hide balances.

result.name: useSecurityAlerts
result.description: Whether to run transactions and signatures through security providers.

result.name: simulateOnChainActions
result.description: Whether to simulate transactions and signatures.

result.name: useTokenDetection
result.description: Whether to auto-detect tokens.

result.name: batchCheckBalances
result.description: Whether to fetch balances in an aggregated manner.

result.name: displayNftMedia
result.description: Whether to display NFT media.

result.name: useNftDetection
result.description: Whether to auto-detect NFTs.

result.name: useExternalPricingData
result.description: Whether to get token price data from an external source.

result.name: showTestnets
result.description: Whether to show testnets.

name: snap_getState
description: `snap_getState` gets the state of the Snap.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
The key of the state to retrieve. If not provided, the entire
state is retrieved. This may contain Lodash-style path syntax, e.g.,
`a.b.c`, with the exception of array syntax.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the client is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the client is locked or unlocked.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getState` method.

result.type: { id: string; url: string; protocols: string[] }[]
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getWebSockets` method.

result.type: { name: string; id: string; type: "mnemonic"; primary: boolean }[]
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_listEntropySources` method.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The method to call on the Snap.

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_manageAccounts` method, which is the result
returned by the Snap.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The operation to perform on the state.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state.

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_manageState` method.

If the operation is `get`, the result is the state. Otherwise, the result is
`null`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of notification to display.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to display in the notification.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the WebSocket connection to open.

parameters.name: protocols
parameters.description: The protocols to use for the WebSocket connection.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_openWebSocket` method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interface id.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to resolve the interface with.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request to be called when the event fires.

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_scheduleBackgroundEvent` method, which is the ID of the scheduled event.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the WebSocket connection to send a message to.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send.

name: snap_setState
description: `snap_setState` sets the state of the Snap.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
The key of the state to update. If not provided, the entire
state is updated. This may contain Lodash-style path syntax, e.g.,
`a.b.c`, with the exception of array syntax.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the state to.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the client is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the client is locked or unlocked.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Custom data to associate with the trace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
A unique identifier when not tracing a callback.
Defaults to 'default' if not provided.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the trace.

parameters.name: parentContext
parameters.type: { [prop: string]: Json; } | boolean | Json[] | number | string | null
parameters.description:
The parent context of the trace.
If provided, the trace will be nested under the parent trace.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Override the start time of the trace.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Custom tags to associate with the trace.

parameters.name: error
parameters.type: { name: string; message: string; stack: string | null; cause: TrackableError | null }
parameters.description: The error object to track.

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_trackEvent` method. This is the ID of the
tracked error, as returned by the Sentry instance in the client.

parameters.name: event
parameters.type: { event: string; properties?: Record<string, Json> | null; sensitiveProperties?: Record<string, Json> | null }
parameters.description: Primary payload object containing other metrics properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interface id.

parameters.name: ui
parameters.description: The components to display in the interface.

name: wallet_getAllSnaps
description:
`wallet_getAllSnaps` gets all installed Snaps. Currently, this can only be
called from `https://snaps.metamask.io`.

result.description:
The result returned by the `wallet_getSnaps` method.

It consists of a map of Snap IDs to either the Snap object or an error.

name: wallet_getSnaps
description: `wallet_getSnaps` gets the requester's permitted and installed Snaps.

result.description:
The result returned by the `wallet_getSnaps` method.

It consists of a map of Snap IDs to either the Snap object or an error.

name: wallet_invokeKeyring
description: `wallet_invokeKeyring` gets the requester's permitted and installed Snaps.

parameters.name: snapId
parameters.description: The ID of the Snap to invoke.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The JSON-RPC request to send to the Snap.

result.description:
The result returned by the `wallet_invokeKeyring` method, which is the result
returned by the Snap.

parameters.name: snapId
parameters.description: The ID of the Snap to invoke.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The JSON-RPC request to send to the Snap.

result.description:
The result returned by the `wallet_invokeSnap` method, which is the result
returned by the Snap.

name: wallet_requestSnaps
description: `wallet_requestSnaps` installs the requested Snaps and requests permission to use them if necessary.

parameters.description:
The request parameters for the `wallet_requestSnaps` method.

It consists of a map of Snap IDs to optional version strings to request.

result.description:
The result returned by the `wallet_requestSnaps` method.

It consists of a map of Snap IDs to either the Snap object or an error.

The result returned by the `wallet_invokeSnap` method, which is the result
returned by the Snap.
